data.enText: a feeling of being sad and without hope

data.chText: 选举结果陆续传来，失败的情绪越来越重。
data.enText: The gloom deepened as the election results came in.

data.chText: 我们注视着船只在越来越浓的暮色中返航。
data.enText: We watched the boats come back in the gathering gloom.

data.chText: 悲观失望；无望；前景暗淡
data.enText: a general feeling of having lost all hope, and of pessimism (= expecting things to go badly)

data.chText: 尽管明显受挫，但对英格兰队来说绝非胜利无望。
data.enText: Despite the obvious setbacks, it is not all doom and gloom for the England team.

data.chText: 使雪上加霜；伤口上撒盐
data.enText: to make an unpleasant situation worse

data.chText: 老板威胁要削减更多的员工，令情况更加恶化。
data.enText: Bosses piled on the agony with threats of more job losses.

data.chText: 悲观失望；无望；前景暗淡
data.enText: a general feeling of having lost all hope, and of pessimism (= expecting things to go badly)

data.chText: 尽管明显受挫，但对英格兰队来说绝非胜利无望。
data.enText: Despite the obvious setbacks, it is not all doom and gloom for the England team.

data.chText: 使雪上加霜；伤口上撒盐
data.enText: to make an unpleasant situation worse

data.chText: 老板威胁要削减更多的员工，令情况更加恶化。
data.enText: Bosses piled on the agony with threats of more job losses.

tr: a state of partial or total darkness
example: he struck a match to dispel the gloom

tr: an atmosphere of depression and melancholy

value.def: The gloom is a state of near darkness.

example.ex: ...the gloom of a foggy November morning...
example.tran: 11月份一个雾蒙蒙的早晨，天空昏暗阴沉

example.ex: I was peering about me in the gloom.

value.def: Gloom is a feeling of sadness and lack of hope.

example.tran: 对经济的忧虑日益加重
